Title: Insecurity has no religious undertone, Fagbemi tells visiting U.S. delegates
Summary: Insecurity has no religious undertone, Fagbemi tells visiting U.S. delegates . Minister of Justice and Attorney-General of the Federation (AGF) dismissed the alleged link between religion and security .

Title: Posers about digital economy five years after expanded NIN
Summary: The mandatory and accelerated enrolment for the National Identification Number (NIN), in the last five years, was Nigeria’s most decisive step . The mandatory encouraging enrollment for the NIN, in the last 5 years, was Nigeria's most decisive step .

Title: National Single Window gains traction ahead of 2026 rollout
Summary: Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS) said President Bola Tinubu’s sustained interest in the National Single Window (NSW) project .

Title: Fubara, Adeleke’s exit shatters embattled PDP, dims 2027 hopes
Summary: Rivers Governor Fubara joined the APC and Osun Governor Adeleke declared declaration of disgrace . The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) suffered twin blows yesterday .

Title: Police intensify security amid curfew in Adamawa council
Summary: Adamawa State Police Command has deployed additional personnel and operational assets to Lamurde Local Council following the state government's decision to impose a curfew in the area . Police intensify security amid security amid curfew in Adamawa council .

Title: Nigeria–US ties are “Treasured and Robust,” must be deepened under Tinubu – Sunday Dare
Summary: Nigeria’s long-standing relationship with the United States remains “treasured, warm and robust,” says presidential spokesman Sunday Dare . Dare: Relationship must be further strengthened in the interest of both nations .

Title: Senate probes utilisation of ₦15bn Safe Schools Fund, queries police’s ₦6.2bn allocation
Summary: The Senate has raised serious concerns over the utilisation of funds released to agencies implementing the Safe Schools Initiative . The Nigerian Police Force received the largest single allocation of ₦6.225 billion from the � 15 billion disbursed in 2023 .

Title: Insecurity: Buck stops on your table, Onaiyekan, Sheikh Lemu, CAN, others tell Tinubu
Summary: Leading Christian, Muslim, traditional and interfaith leaders from across Nigeria have delivered a blunt message to President Bola Tinubu . They say the worsening insecurity sits squarely on his desk .

Title: Ogun records 502 cases of incest, sexual assault, domestic violence
Summary: Ogun State government records 502 cases of incest, sexual assault, domestic violence . Ogun recorded no fewer than 502 cases in 11 months .

Title: Osun gov poll: Why I joined Accord Party — Adeleke
Summary: Governor Ademola Adeleke, yesterday, officially joined the Accord Party, AP, in Osun State . The party's primary is less than 24 hours before the governorship primary .

Title: US congressman visits Benue, seeks global attention to IDP crisis
Summary: US Congressman Riley Moore shared accounts of violence against Christian communities in Benue State, recounting what he said he was told during a visit to camps for internally displaced persons . Moore met Tiv and Catholic leaders during his visit to the state . He said discussions focused on terrorism in the North-East and killings in the Middle Belt .

Title: One dies in Oyo fire, two rescued
Summary: Fire resulted from a lighted charcoal cooking pot left unattended, which ignited nearby combustible materials . The fire was a result of electrical sparks from a solar inverter control board on the upper floor of the building . A fire also engulfed the Agric Business Development Agency at Total Garden in Ibadan .

Soyinka had recounted an encounter which he described as recent in Ikoyi, Lagos State, that left him shocked at what he considered an extravagant display of state security . Title: Edo final-year student dies in sign-out motorcade crash
Summary: A yet-to-be-identified final-year student of Ambrose Alli University, Ekpoma, Edo State, has lost his life in a road crash . The accident occurred on Monday shortly after the students finished their final examination . NAN reported that one person died while five others were injured in the crash .

Title: Accident: Kwara varsity begs gov for overhead bridge
Summary: Kwara State University has appealed to the state governor, AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq, to construct an overhead bridge along the Shao/Malete Road to reduce accident rates on the busy route to the institution .
